data: Life at Centre Activities & Organizations Activities & Organizations Your circles expand and so do your connections From day one, you’ll feel like you’re among friends as upperclassmen, faculty and staff help you move into your new home. Move In is just the beginning. You’ll soon realize on Centre’s vibrant campus, every day brings new experiences — and friends to share them with. More in Activities & Organizations Clubs & Organizations Attend the Activities Expo The annual Activities Expo each September immediately helps you plug-in with Greek Life as well as multiple clubs, organizations, and activities available on campus and the in the local community. Student Clubs and Organizations Athletics Cheer on the Colonels! Centre student-athletes compete in 25 NCAA Division III intercollegiate sports throughout the year, so put on your Centre gear and support the Colonels Go Colonels! The Arts Express Yourself Centre cultivates artist expression. Whether you want to begin a career in the arts, experience a course or two, or simply participate — explore what makes you, you. Explore opportunities to sing, dance, act, play, and create. Follow your passions and refine your artistic talents. Learn more about Centre's creative options Well-being It’s the little things that make a difference. Centre has activities and opportunities that relieve stress and feed the brain at the time they’re needed most. Late Night Breakfast Finals week brings hours of study and preparation which means the campus tradition Late-Night Breakfast served by faculty and staff. Make a New Best Friend One of the best ways to relieve stress is making a new four-legged friend at one of Centre’s dog therapy events. Get in Some Reps The Buck Fitness Center in Sutcliffe Hall is equipped with exercise machines, free weights. It is directly across from the elevated walking track and basketball courts. Student Events Teddy Talks: How to Communicate Effectively The CLC mascot Teddy welcomes you to the first Teddy Talk this spring with our guest speaker, Ann Goodwin, Associate Dean for Student Well-Being. Come listen and share your thoughts on how to communicate effectively! Teddy Talks this term will take place on Monday evenings at 8pm in Crounse 302.
